bibl.title: Asian Features in the Representation of Harpocrates.
bibl.note: Alexandria, Graeco-Roman Museum, Inv. 7118; 7716. The facial features of the statuettes seem to be of the Mongol type. The existence of Mongolians in Egypt must have been a result of the contact between Egypt and Asia.

bibl.title: Alessandria e il mondo ellenistico-romano. I Centenario del Museo Greco-Romano. Alessandria, 23-27 Novembre 1992. Atti del II Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano

bibl.seg: HAGGAG Mona, Asian Features in the Representation of Harpocrates.

Alessandria e il mondo ellenistico-romano. I Centenario del Museo Greco-Romano. Alessandria, 23-27 Novembre 1992. Atti del II Congresso Internazionale Italo-Egiziano (Roma, 1995) pp. 323-325 et pl. 48.

Alexandria, Graeco-Roman Museum, Inv. 7118; 7716. The facial features of the statuettes seem to be of the Mongol type. The existence of Mongolians in Egypt must have been a result of the contact between Egypt and Asia.
